result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Stockwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50 per month. 2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William E Stockwell
